resources.name: MatchHistory_FetchMatchHistory
resources.description:
Get recent matches for a player  
There are 3 optional query parameters: `startIndex`, `endIndex`, and `queue`. `queue` can be one of `null`, `competitive`, `custom`, `deathmatch`, `ggteam`, `newmap`, `onefa`, `snowball`, `spikerush`, or `unrated`.  

Variables:
 - `{Riot entitlement}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Entitlement](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-entitlement)
 - `{base64 encoded Riot token}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Token](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-token)
 - `{client version}`: Read [Common Components - Client Version](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#client-version)
 - `{client platform}`: Read [Common Components - Client Platform](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#client-platform)
 - `{region}`: Read [Common Components - Region](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#region)
 - `{puuid}`: Read [Common Components - PUUID](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#puuid)

resources.name: MatchDetails_FetchMatchDetails

Includes everything that the in-game match details screen shows including damage and kill positions.

resources.name: MMR_FetchLeaderboard
resources.description:
Get the competitive leaderboard for a given season  
The query parameter `query` can be added to search for a username.  

Variables:
 - `{Riot entitlement}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Entitlement](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-entitlement)
 - `{base64 encoded Riot token}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Token](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-token)
 - `{client version}`: Read [Common Components - Client Version](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#client-version)
 - `{region}`: Read [Common Components - Region](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#region)
 - `{season id}`: The ID for the season. Can be found using the `Seasons` property from the [Content_FetchContent](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/PVP%20Endpoints/GET%20Content_FetchContent.md) endpoint.
 - `{start index}`: The index to start the leaderboard from. Typically `0`
 - `{size}`: The number of results to get from the leaderboard. Typically `510`

resources.name: Store_GetEntitlements
resources.description:
List what the player owns (agents, skins, buddies, ect.)  
Correlate with the UUIDs in [Content_FetchContent](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/PVP%20Endpoints/GET%20Content_FetchContent.md) to know what items are owned.   
Category names and IDs:  

`ItemTypeID` | Name
--- | ---
`01bb38e1-da47-4e6a-9b3d-945fe4655707` | Agents
`f85cb6f7-33e5-4dc8-b609-ec7212301948` | Contracts
`d5f120f8-ff8c-4aac-92ea-f2b5acbe9475` | Sprays
`dd3bf334-87f3-40bd-b043-682a57a8dc3a` | Gun Buddies
`3f296c07-64c3-494c-923b-fe692a4fa1bd` | Cards
`e7c63390-eda7-46e0-bb7a-a6abdacd2433` | Skins
`3ad1b2b2-acdb-4524-852f-954a76ddae0a` | Skin Variants
`de7caa6b-adf7-4588-bbd1-143831e786c6` | Titles  

Variables:
 - `{Riot entitlement}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Entitlement](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-entitlement)
 - `{base64 encoded Riot token}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Token](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-token)
 - `{region}`: Read [Common Components - Region](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#region)
 - `{puuid}`: Read [Common Components - PUUID](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#puuid)
 - `{ItemTypeID}`: Optional url path to only return entitlements belonging to this type ID. If omitted, this endpoint will return entitlements of all types.

resources.name: Party_SetCustomGameSettings
resources.description:
Changes the settings for a custom game  

Variables:
 - `{Riot entitlement}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Entitlement](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-entitlement)
 - `{base64 encoded Riot token}`: Read [Common Components - Riot Token](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#riot-token)
 - `{client version}`: Read [Common Components - Client Version](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#client-version)
 - `{region}`: Read [Common Components - Region](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#region)
 - `{party id}`: Read [Common Components - Party ID](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/common-components.md#party-id)
 - `{map}`: Appears to be of the format `/Game/Maps/{map name}/{map name}` where `{map name}` is the asset name for the map. You can use the [Content_FetchContent](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/PVP%20Endpoints/GET%20Content_FetchContent.md) endpoint to get map asset names.
 - `{mode}`: The asset path for the gamemode in the format `/Game/GameModes/{id}/{name}.{name}_C`. For example, in unrated, the `{id}` is `Bomb` and the `{name}` is `BombGameMode`. It's easiest to experiment with this value by changing the mode in Valorant and using the [Party_FetchParty](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/Party/GET%20Party_FetchParty.md) endpoint to see the resulting value.
 - `{pod}`: The ID of the pod to use for the server. You can view pods and associated pings for each party member with the [Party_FetchParty](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/Party/GET%20Party_FetchParty.md) endpoint.

resources.name: Auth Cookies
resources.description: Prepare cookies for auth request

resources.name: Auth Request
resources.description:
Perform authorization request to get token  
Requires cookies from the [Auth Cookies](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/Riot%20Auth/POST%20Auth%20Cookies.md) stage. The token can be found in the `uri` property.  

Variables:
 - `{username}`: The player username / email for signing in
 - `{password}`: The player password for signing in

resources.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
resources.description:
Submits a multi-factor authentication code for login  

Variables:
 - `{mfa code}`: The code received from the secondary location (email)

resources.name: Cookie Reauth
resources.description:
Get a new token using the cookies from a previous authorization request  
Use the saved cookies from [Auth Request](https://github.com/techchrism/valorant-api-docs/tree/trunk/docs/Riot%20Auth/PUT%20Auth%20Request.md). The token can be found from the url this request redirects to.  
Recommended to use this endpoint instead of storing the password and sending it again.
